text:
Watch NFL Prospect O.J. Howard Snag 60-Mph Passes from a JUGS Machine at Close Range Updated: February 23, 2017 Miami Marlins P Steve Cishek Safety-Squat Bar Forward Lunge Views 829,440 Colby Lewis Hour of Power: Arm Circuit Views 175,579 Views 130,497 Arizona Diamondbacks 3B Ryan Roberts Single-Arm, Single-Leg Cable Row How to Cover the Bag and Turn a Double Play With Ryan Roberts of the Arizona Diamondbacks UC Irvine's Sacrifice Bunt Technique Views 107,699 Steve Cishek Dumbbell Reverse Lunge Views 185,378 Bottoms-Up Kettlebell Carry With Kansas City Royals P Tim Collins New Balance Baseball 2013 Photo Shoot Long Toss Program With Tim Collins and Steve Cishek Previous Next 
There's a reason O.J. Howard is the consensus No. 1 tight end in this year's NFL Draft class. 
The 6-foot-6, 251-pound Alabama product has the rare blend of size, speed and athleticism to be a mismatch machine at the next level. Earlier today, FOX Sports: PROcast tweeted out a video of Howard catching blistering passes from a JUGS machine at a frighteningly close distance: WOW! 
60 MPH out of the jugs gun— no wonder @TheRealOJHoward is the #1 TE prospect in the #NFLDraft (feat. @darealmike_dub and @D_shorts6 ) pic.twitter.com/yDhUD8eshc 
— FOX Sports: PROcast (@PROcast) February 23, 2017 
According to the tweet, those footballs were being gunned out at roughly 60 mph! Since 2008, just two quarterbacks have thrown a ball that fast at the NFL Combine . Odds are, their target wasn't standing within spitting distance. Also, peep that ridiculous one-handed grab Howard makes at the start of the video. I didn't think physics worked like that. Howard showed off his incredibly strong hands in a video last week: BEAST! 
. @TheRealOjHoward demonstrates why he's the top TE prospect in the 2017 #NFLDraft ! 
Tag the @NFL team that should draft OJ. pic.twitter.com/UbtCzYOLdQ 
— FOX Sports: PROcast (@PROcast) February 17, 2017 
Plate Flips with a 55-pound plate? That's no joke. All signs indicate that Howard will have a brilliant showing next week at the 2017 NFL Combine.
